answers.answer: After both surgeries I was swollen and had "discomfort" for about 6-8 months.  My surgeon and endo both explained it was scar tissue and residual swelling (including angry lymph nodes).  It did resolve itself completely - for me.  Have you discussed it with your endo?Not sure on the swollen abdomen but I have a couple of questions.Have you had your blood sugars checked?  A significant number of us with thyroid problems develop Type II diabetes and Type II loves to pack the pounds on the abdomen.Next question:  do you have problems with your ovaries?  Plenty of us also have PCOS (poly cystic ovarian syndrome) and develop ovarian cysts.  Has your OB/GYN checked you (including a trans-vaginal ultrasound)?I hope that you get some answers and some relief soon!

question: In September I had a total thyroidectomy for a multi nodular goitre/hyperthyroidism/compression symptoms etc.   The surgery apparently was straightforward.  However I still have a constant feeling of a lump in my throat, constant sore throat on the left side, discomfort when swallowing, swelling of neck/under chin and lower face in the mornings.  Also discomfort on left side of chest exacerbated by wearing bra and a passenger side seatbelt.  Also since surgery my abdomen has swollen awfully
